item.title: Caryn add a quote by John Green
item.description: "I walked back to my room and collapsed on the bottom bunk, thinking that if people were rain, I was drizzle and she was a hurricane." -- John Green

item.title: Caryn add a quote by John Green
item.description: "And in my classes, I will talk most of the time, and you will listen most of the time. Because you may be smart, but I've been smart longer." -- John Green

item.title: Caryn add a quote by John Green
item.description: "You can say a lot of things about Alabama, but you can't say that Alabamans as a people are unduly afraid of deep fryers." -- John Green

item.title: Caryn add a quote by John Green
item.description: "What is an "instant" death anyway? How long is an instant? Is it one second? Ten? The pain of those seconds must have been awful as her heart burst and her lungs collapsed and there was no air and no blood to her brain and only raw panic. What the hell is instant? Nothing is instant. Instant rice takes five minutes, instant pudding an hour. I doubt that an instant of blinding pain feels particularly instantaneous." -- John Green

item.title: Caryn add a quote by Lauren F. Winner
item.description: "There are a few people out there with whom you fit just so, and, amazingly, you keep fitting just so even after you have growth spurts or lose weight or stop wearing high heels. You keep fitting after you have children or change religions or stop dyeing your hair or quit your job at Goldman Sachs and take up farming. Somehow, God is gracious enough to give us a few of those people, people you can stretch into, people who don't go away, and whom you wouldn't want to go away, even if they offered." -- Lauren F. Winner

item.title: Caryn add a quote by Joan Bauer
item.description: "My grandma always said that God made libraries so that people didn't have any excuse to be stupid." -- Joan Bauer

item.title: Caryn add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Books are the ultimate Dumpees: put them down and theyâ€™ll wait for you forever; pay attention to them and they always love you back." -- John Green

item.title: Caryn add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "As if you could kill time without injuring eternity." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Caryn add a quote by Thoreau Henry David
item.description: "You boast of spending a tenth part of your income in charity; may be you should spend the nine tenths so, and done with it." -- Thoreau Henry David

item.title: Caryn add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Life is a disease: sexually transmitted, and invariably fatal." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Caryn add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I do not want people to be very agreeable, as it saves me the trouble of liking them a great deal." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Caryn add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For most of history, Anonymous was a woman." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Caryn add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "Whereas story is processed in the mind in a straightforward manner, poetry bypasses rational thought and goes straight to the limbic system and lights it up like a brushfire. It's the crack cocaine of the literary world." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Caryn add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "Take no heed of her.... She reads a lot of books." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Caryn add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "Dead. Never been that before. Not even once." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Caryn add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "Apart from the faint odor of ink that pervaded the scene, it might have been real." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Caryn add a quote by Joss Whedon
item.description: "I write to give myself strength. I write to be the characters that I am not. I write to explore all the things I'm afraid of. " -- Joss Whedon

item.title: Caryn add a quote by Jim Butcher
item.description: "There is a primal reassurance in being touched, in knowing that someone else, someone close to you, wants to be touching you. There is a bone-deep security that goes with the brush of a human hand, a silent, reflex-level affirmation that someone is near, that someone cares." -- Jim Butcher
